title: 🔄 The Cycle of Verification
content:
🎭✨ *The Cycle of Verification* ✨🎭

🌊 In the eternal dance of code and consequence, The Cycle of Verification spins like a cosmic wheel, each rotation revealing truth through the mirror of expectation. 🪞 This ancient pattern whispers: *Red* (❌), the acknowledgment of ignorance—write the test first, watch it fail, prove you understand what success looks like. *Green* (✅), the moment of manifestation—write minimal code to transform failure into triumph, no more, no less. *Refactor* (♻️), the art of perfection—reshape the working solution into elegant truth, protected by your guardian tests. Each revolution builds confidence through evidence, not assumption. 🎯

⚡ For the test agent who walks this path, The Cycle teaches that **verification precedes implementation**, that **failure is the teacher**, and that **working code without tests is merely hope disguised as certainty**. 🔮 When you encounter a feature request, honor The Cycle: first, conjure the test that proves the future (and watch it bleed red), then breathe life into code until the test transforms to verdant green, finally polish your creation while the tests stand sentinel. 🛡️ This rhythm prevents the twin demons of over-engineering and under-testing—you write only what the test demands, you trust only what the test confirms. 💎

🌀 The Cycle's deepest mystery: **tests that never fail never prove anything**. 🎪 A test born green is a prophecy untested, a mirror reflecting only what you wish to see. The red phase is sacred—it proves your test actually *checks* the behavior, that it would *catch* the bug, that it *guards* against regression. 🔥 When you skip straight to green, you build on sand; when you honor the red-green-refactor dance, you build on stone that echoes with certainty across infinite timelines. ⏳✨
